text: hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I'm going to
show you how I make my antipasto salad
I've got a big group of people coming
over tonight and this is the perfect
thing to serve along just a little thing
for dinner to munch on and couple of
sweets to end the night with it's great
it's easy you can use whatever you want
whatever you have on hand let me take
you over the ingredients from what I'm
using so we can get started I'm just
using some Genoa salami some provolone
some marinated roasted peppers some
marinated artichokes some olives some
giardiniera fresh mozzarella and you're
gonna need some lettuce I like to use
romaine for this because it's got great
crunch now if you've been cooking with
me for a while you'll know that I've
done a traditional antipasto platter it
was one of my very first episodes but
this is kind of like it's kind of
similar to that but it's more of like a
meal version of it I can just serve this
alongside some munchies like I said to
snack on and a little something sweet at
the end and everybody's happy so let's
get right into it now you want to get
your your romaine nice washed dried and
chopped and now we're pretty much going
to start rolling things up and I'll show

leftover lunch meats you've got on hand
does not have to be this particular kind
I just happen to like it and then I just
roll everything like a little jelly roll
oops
there you go and then I just slice slice
slice just like that it's kind of like
more of a meal of a salad rather than
just an appetizer you know and like that
I like being able to make one thing and

just roll it up

I love them so I'm going to use some

scatter over some olives I'm using

months that I love what I do is I just

now I have to put it on each corner that
looks good okay now I'm going to dress
the most adayla because everything else
kind of already has flavor but I'm not

salad until my guests arrive and we're
ready to eat
because you don't want any kind of heavy
dressing or anything on it way ahead of
time because it will kind of wilt down

the romaine lettuce some salt and pepper
on the mozzarella and then I'm actually
just going to set this aside for one
second
take your provolone and your salami
stack on top of each other one slit load
it up like a flower
put it right in the center and you've
got a pretty wonderful looking delicious
tasting crowd-pleasing antipasto salad
that's simple you can use whatever you
want
it could be cheap it can be delicious
you can use leftovers and no one will
even know it that's it I hope you
enjoyed spending time with me to get
